tool.name: Alpha diversity summary
tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
**WARNING**. This tool requires two types of files: **Otuphyl file** get in *Compute otuphyl* and **metadata.tsv file**.\
**What does it do?**\
*Alpha diversity summary* represent in three different tables the different richness stimators: Chao1, InvSimpson and Shannon indexes.\
Tables contain in first column: type, residuals and significance code.\
In the first line appears different parameters calcalated in every richness stimator index:\
- Degree freedom (Df).\
- Sum of squares (Sum Sq).\
- Mean square (Mean Sq).\
- F value.\
- P-value (Pr).\
**Example**
Three different richnes stimators::
Alpha diversity Chao1 Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr type 2 104.3 52.15 6.651 0.00259 ** Residuals 55 431.2 7.84 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
Alpha diversity InvSimpson Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr type 2 5.02 2.509 1.489 0.235 Residuals 55 92.67 1.685
Alpha diversity Shannon Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr type 2 0.527 0.2637 2.076 0.135 Residuals 55 6.987 0.1270
(*) If P-value has a value below 0.05 result will be marked with asterisks (See *Signif. codes*).
